message.content:
cs.MA, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CR 

The paper deals with the problem of persistent monitoring of geographical nodes using a group of heterogeneous mobile agents. This problem falls under the category of multi-agent systems (cs.MA) and robotics (cs.RO) as it involves designing policies for multiple agents to perform a task. The use of a utility function and optimization techniques to maximize the probability of event detection suggests the involvement of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) in the paper. The problem also involves control and optimization (cs.SY) as the authors propose a suboptimal dispatch policy design with a known optimality gap. Finally, the paper discusses how the proposed algorithm can be implemented in a decentralized manner, which suggests the involvement of cryptography and security (cs.CR).
